intro: Diaphananthe subsimplex, commonly known as the simple-leaved diaphananthe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its simple, ovate leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers clustered in inflorescences, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments within its native range. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
